meanings.definition: A place where workers are employed for long hours at low wages and under unhealthy conditions.
meanings.sent1: Many people work in sweatshops for very little pay.
meanings.sent2: Sweatshops often have poor working conditions.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a sweatshop sounds like a place where you'd sweat a lot while working!
meanings.sent4: In some countries, sweatshops are like modern-day factories of hardship.
meanings.sent5: The image of sweatshops can be quite distressing to think about.

meanings.sent1: She sweatshops in a garment factory to earn money.
meanings.sent2: Many individuals sweatshops to make ends meet.
meanings.sent3: When she needs extra cash, she decides to sweatshops for a few hours.
meanings.sent4: He sweatshops tirelessly to support his family.
meanings.sent5: The workers sweatshops day and night to fulfill orders.
